text: â€œHippie Christian Groupâ€ Turns Out To Be Cult That Tells Followers To Donate Their Kidneys A controversial group dubbed â€œThe Kidney Cultâ€ encourages followers to donate their organs to strangers. Officially named [The Jesus Christians](https://www.boredpanda.com/horrible-childhood-stories/), the group has consequently drawn criticism and accusations of being a manipulative and destructive cult. The Jesus Christians, a secretive community led by David McKay, was formed in 1981. Its headquarters are tucked away in suburban Melbourne, Australia. The Kidney Cultâ€™s Aussie members live in a nondescript home, but smaller congregations have since emerged in other parts of the world, including Canada, the US, Mexico, and Kenya. Almost two decades ago, David and his followers, who currently include a few hundred worldwide, hosted a whipping of their members in a public display of supposed atonement for the sins of others, [7News ](https://7news.com.au/spotlight/spotlight-exclusives/7news-spotlight-investigates-the-kidney-cult-inside-the-church-that-encourages-followers-to-donate-their-organs-c-14720590)reported on Monday (May 20). The Jesus Christians, dubbed â€œThe Kidney Cult,â€ encourage followers to donate their organs to strangers Image credits: [TV Central](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g3voJAOXWI0) Despite other [scandals](https://www.boredpanda.com/jordan-turpin-boyfriend-house-of-horror-matt-ryan/) emerging in the news, the group is best known for being referred to as The Kidney Cult, with devout followers encouraged to donate a kidney to complete strangers as an act of kindness. The purpose of this seemingly heroic gesture is currently unknown. [Cult ](https://www.boredpanda.com/man-raised-cult-kingston-group-mormon-reveals-horrifying-truth-inside-practices/)specialist Rick Ross told 7News: â€œThink of the people that have donated kidneys because Dave McKay influenced them and coerced them in his own methodical way to give up a kidney. â€œThose people are scarred literally for the rest of their lives. â€œDave McKayâ€™s demands on them will change their lives forever.â€ Image credits: [TV Central](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g3voJAOXWI0) Rick has reportedly followed The Jesus Christians closely and subsequently found that the group fit the profile of a â€œdestructive [cult.](https://www.boredpanda.com/children-of-god-cult-survivor-horrifying-stories/)â€ He explained: â€œOver the years, he has recruited very young people often, and they are idealistic. â€œThey care about the condition of the world. â€œThey have faith in God, they believe in the Bible.â€ The group has drawn criticism and accusations of being a manipulative and destructive cult Image credits: [TV Central](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g3voJAOXWI0) â€œAnd Dave McKay manipulates that and orchestrates that for his own purposes. â€œI see him as a deeply narcissistic man, a man that craves attention, and he will do virtually anything so that he can get attention.â€ In 2007, a Canadian hospital refused to accept the offer of a kidney to a stranger by one of the groupâ€™s members as a way of expressing his faith in God, [The Sydney Morning Herald](https://www.smh.com.au/national/hospital-refuses-to-accept-kidney-20070605-gdqb00.html) reported. At the time, over half of the Jesus Christian members had donated a kidney to people they did not know prior to agreeing to donate. Image credits: [TV Central](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g3voJAOXWI0) Renee Spencer, mother to daughter Ellicia, who has been embroiled in the [cult](https://www.boredpanda.com/escaping-twin-flames-universe-jeff-shaleia-netflix/) since 2017, told 7News that Elicia found The Jesus Christians on YouTube when she was 22 years old. According to Renee, her daughter began fervently watching their videos, emailing a contact address on the channel, and meeting members in person. One of the members, a man named Joseph, would reportedly become her husband within months. Renee told 7News: â€œShe fell in love. I think she genuinely fell in love with Joseph almost as soon as she met him.â€ The secretive community, led by David McKay, was formed in 1981 Image credits: [ The ğ“ğ‘ğ”ğ“ğ‡ shall make you free](https://youtu.be/Fa-wolpHn04) When Ellicia joined The Jesus Christians, Renee reportedly said she didnâ€™t initially open up completely on the nature of the church. Instead, Elicia directed her mom to a website that, on the surface, â€œjust seemed very much like that website that they were just this hippie [Christian](https://www.boredpanda.com/woman-moves-from-gibraltar-to-oklahoma-live-trad-wife-lifestyle/) group.â€ Ultimately, Renee came to understand that her daughter hadnâ€™t simply joined any Christian group. An official [court document ](https://www.countycourt.vic.gov.au/files/documents/2023-12/judgement-spencer-v-mckay.pdf)showed that on December 18, 2023, Renee won the case, and a judge awarded her $85,000 in damages and $100,000 in court costs. â€œThis case involves a plaintiff whose daughter joined a religious group,â€ the document reads. â€œMs Spencer considers that the religious group is a coercive [cult](https://www.boredpanda.com/british-boy-alex-batty-found-alive-france-6-years-missing/).â€ It further states: â€œMs Spencer has become estranged from her daughter and believes that the estrangement has been orchestrated by the defendant in his capacity as the leader of that group.â€ The groupâ€™s headquarters are tucked away in suburban Melbourne, Australia Elicia went as far as to testify against her mother, further damaging an already frayed relationship. Meanwhile, David has been adamant that he is not the figurehead of a cult, telling 7News that calling his church a cult is akin to calling someone an â€œa**hole.â€ He told the Australian broadcaster: â€œItâ€™s just an insult. â€œThatâ€™s all itâ€™s, itâ€™s purely and simply an insult.â€ watching this kidney cult on spotlight, the owner of Jesus Christians is not even a real Christian.
